Code CDPTR
) This IRM section provides an overview of the CDPTR Command Code. (
) Purpose These section provides instructions for inputting and researching and Collection Due Processing Tracking System. (
) Audience: These instructions are intended for campus tax examiners in Automated Collection System Support (ACSS). (
) Policy Owne
irector, Collection Policy, SBSE. (
) Program Owner SBSE Collection Policy, Employment Tax. (
) Primary Stakeholder
ampus operations ACS Support. (
) Program Goal
rocedures for using the CDP tracking system is in
, Liability Collection - Collection Appeal Rights (

) The Collection Due Process Tracking System (CDPTS) is a inventory system to track CDP Inventory from time of receipt through resolu- tion. It allows Compliance areas to research CDP cases utilizing an IDRS Command Code (CDPTR) or input and update CDP cases via the web Intranet system. (
) A Collection Due Process Record is added to a module on IDRS when a
or other adequate CDP request is determined to be valid. (
) CDP Cases may be researched using Command Code CDPTR(Deﬁner T), which will display the most recent actions on active cases selected by TIN. (

) CDPTR Deﬁner T is designed to be used by Customer Service Representa- tives speaking with Taxpayers about their COLLECTION DUE PROCESS T requests. It provides them with a summary of the current status for the request(s) of the Primary Taxpayer. (
) CDPTR Deﬁner T is activated by inputting the formatted TIN of the Primary Taxpayer. See Exhibit

) CDPTR with Deﬁner T produces a formatted summary of the current status the case. Included in the summary is the Tin, Filer-Code, Tax Period, Number, IRS Rcvd Date, Name Ctrl, MFT, Case Type, Location Code, Office Function, Secondary TIN and Reason Code in the information about the current stage of the case.
